data.title: The Best Dallas Mavericks Power Forwards of All Time
data.meta_description: Over 200 sports fans have voted on the 50+ athletes on Best Dallas Mavericks Power Forwards of All Time. Current Top 3: Dirk Nowitzki, Sam Perkins, Shawn ...
data.text:
Ranked By

1.1K votes

206 voters

3 reranks

Voting Rules

Vote up the players who had the most success for the Dallas Mavericks

Big fan of Dallas basketball? Then check out this list of Dallas Mavericks power forwards. It includes almost every power forward from throughout Dallas Mavericks history, including current power forwards and past ones. Featuring some of the greatest NBA power forwards of all time, the best Mavericks PFs include Dirk Nowitzki, Sam Perkins, Roy Tarpley, Antwan Jamison, and Herb Williams.

In the 2021-22 NBA season, the current Dallas Mavs starting PFs and backup PFs are Kristaps Porzingis, Dwight Powell, Maximilian Kleber, and Dorian Finney-Smith.

Who are the best power forwards in Dallas Mavericks history? Here is every player who has ever held the position of Dallas Mavericks power forward.

Most divisive: Antoine Walker

Over 200 Ranker voters have come together to rank this list of The Best Dallas Mavericks Power Forwards of All Time

Birthplace : WÃ¼rzburg, Germany

Nationality : Germany

Team : Dallas Mavericks

Position : Power forward

Dallas Mavericks: 1998-2019

The iconic power forward, Dirk Nowitzki joined the Mavericks in 1998 through a draft day trade and went on to become the most legendary player in the team's history. Possessing a unique shooting touch for a big man, Nowitzki revolutionized the power forward position with his exceptional scoring ability and knack for stretching the floor. As a result, he earned 14 All-Star selections, an MVP award in 2007, and led the Mavs to their first NBA Championship in 2011, also securing the Finals MVP title. Dirk's storied career not only solidified his place among the best Dallas Mavericks power forwards of all time but also as one of the most outstanding players in the league.

Birthplace : New York City, USA, New York

Nationality : United States of America

Position : Power forward, Center

Dallas Mavericks: 1984-1990

Sam Perkins joined the Mavericks in 1984, selected as the 4th overall pick in the NBA Draft. Known for his versatility on offense, Perkins was one of the first power forwards to incorporate the three-point shot into his game consistently. This inside-out threat made him a matchup nightmare for opponents, and he was a crucial contributor during the Mavericks' deep playoff runs in the late 1980s. Although he didn't win any awards while with the team, Perkins' groundbreaking style of play and consistent production earned him a well-deserved spot among the best power forwards in Mavericks history.

Birthplace : Waukegan, Illinois, USA

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Dallas Mavericks

Position : Small forward, Power forward

Dallas Mavericks: 2009-2014

Acquired via trade in 2009, Shawn Marion quickly became a vital cog in the Mavericks' machine with his do-it-all playing style. His ability to defend multiple positions, run the floor, and finish around the rim made him an invaluable asset for Dallas, particularly during their championship run in 2011. In addition to his on-court contributions, Marion brought a wealth of experience and veteran leadership to the Mavs, culminating in his selection to the All-Defensive Second Team in 2011. Marion's unique skillset and undeniable impact on the Mavericks' success solidify his position among the team's best power forwards.

Birthplace : Ventspils, Latvia

Nationality : Latvia

Team : Washington Wizards

Position : Power forward

Dallas Mavericks: 2019-2022

Secured through a blockbuster trade in 2019, Kristaps Porzingis immediately established himself as a vital part of the Mavericks' future alongside Luka Doncic. Standing at 7'3", Porzingis utilizes his height and shooting ability to create mismatches for opposing defenses, earning the nickname "The Unicorn." In addition to his offensive prowess, he is an imposing presence on the defensive end with his shot-blocking skills. Though still early in his tenure with the Mavs, Porzingis' unique blend of size and sharpshooting has already etched his name among the top power forwards in team history.

Birthplace : New York City, New York

Nationality : United States of America

Position : Power forward, Center

Dallas Mavericks: 1986-1991, 1994-1995

Drafted seventh overall by the Mavericks in 1986, Roy Tarpley showcased immense potential with his impressive athleticism and ability to score both inside and outside the paint. However, his career was marred by a series of off-court issues, limiting what could have been a highly productive stint in Dallas. Despite his tumultuous tenure, Tarpley's undeniable talent, including a Sixth Man of the Year award in 1988, lands him among the organization's top power forwards.

Birthplace : Dresden, Tennessee

Nationality : United States of America

Team : Dallas Mavericks, Toronto Raptors, Boston Celtics, Denver Nuggets, Washington Wizards

Position : Power forward

Dallas Mavericks: 1993-1996, 2002-2003

A tenacious rebounder and physical defender, Popeye Jones joined the Mavericks in 1993 after being selected 41st overall in the NBA Draft. His relentless work ethic and ability to contribute on both ends of the floor made him a fan favorite during his three seasons in Dallas. While never an All-Star, Jones' determination and hustle have earned him recognition as one of the top power forwards to don a Mavericks uniform.
